entry.title: Re: Add variant of main program to called program in a ba...
entry.content:
Answer to the 2 questions:

  1. The released API is either BP_JOB_DELETE or BAPI_XBP_JOB_DELETE (*).
    BUT if you want to have 2 jobs, why would you need to delete one? Not a good practice, keep things clear: the job was scheduled so don't delete it. Also, why do you need to submit a new job?
  2. The ABAP statement SUBMIT VIA JOB USING SELECTION-SET always creates a new variant with a system-generated number, which is the copy of the original variant merged with the parameters passed explicitly. If you want to use a given variant and you don't want a variant with a system-generated number, you must call the function JOB_SUBMIT instead of SUBMIT VIA JOB.

(*) Concerning XBP, as it works on top of XMI, you'll need to wrap the call of BAPI_XBP_JOB_DELETE between BAPI_XMI_LOGON (select the interface XBP, latest version 3.0 ) and BAPI_XMI_LOGOFF.

entry.title: Transportation Management - What's New in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602
entry.content:
We are happy to announce the innovations for Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602. The What's New Presentation provides an additional overview of all innovations.

The innovations are balanced across the areas core functions, user experience, extensibility and integration, thus providing value addition for the whole portfolio. As always, this release has been a great team effort, and I am more than happy to dive right into it.

CORE FUNCTIONS

Subcontracting Process with Transportation Management

With this release we enable the long awaited and heavily demanded subcontracting process (scope item BMY)  to work with Transportation Management in which you deliver raw materials/components to a subcontractor and in return receive the finished product. You can now plan the outbound transport and/or the inbound transport and the system makes sure that also the freight costs involved are properly distributed and allocated to the finished product. For the outbound transport you can additionally leverage Warehouse Management in Public Cloud to efficiently run your warehouse operations.

Figure 1: Subcontracting Process and involved outbound and inbound transports

Consignment Fill-Up and Pickup with Transportation Management

Similar to the subcontracting process, also the consignment fill-up and pickup process (scope item 1IU) is a widely used process that until now was not supported with Transportation Management. With this release we lifted this limitation and you can now plan the transport to fill-up the consignment stock at the customer as well as the pickup of any unused or no longer required consignment stock back to your on premise. For the outbound transport you can additionally leverage Warehouse Management in Public Cloud to efficiently run your warehouse operations.

Figure 2: Customer Consignment Process and involved outbound and inbound transports

Cross-company Purchasing Organizations

In the past you could only use purchasing organizations in freight orders and bookings that were uniquely assigned to a specific company code. If you have a central purchasing organization that procures transports for different company codes this leads to the creation of many artificial purchasing organizations, one for each company code.

Now you can use purchasing organizations that are not directly assigned to a company code. What remains however is, that the company code, for which this purchasing organization is procuring a concrete transport, must be uniquely specified on the freight order/booking to make sure that the freight costs are later allocated properly.

Figure 3: Cross Purchasing Organization can be used in Freight Documents

USER EXPERIENCE

Improve Loading Process with Cloud Transportation and Warehouse Management

This feature ensures consistent, simple and flexible loading process handling when using Transportation Management with WM by enabling customers to skip the loading step in the system before posting goods issue and checking out the freight order by automatically setting the respective status in the load and unload freight orders or with an RF device.

It eliminates unnecessary user interactions if recording the detailed loading/unloading activities are not important.

Figure 4: Loading Activities were automatically posted

EXTENSIBILITY

Print Form Extensibility for Dangerous Goods Print Forms

Until now it was not possible to extend the pre-delivered dangerous goods print forms and to customize its content. With this feature we provide completely reworked form data providers and extensible form templates that enable you to adapt the print forms to your very specific needs.

Local APIs for Freight Order/Booking improved

Local APIs are crucial to build extensions and custom apps and to complement the existing standard functionality. We invested significantly into Local APIs and provide now a set of operations for freight orders and bookings. More information is available on the API Hub.

Figure 5: Local APIs to extend business processes within SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

INTEGRATION

New Operations in OData APIs for Freight Order/Booking

Not only did we invest into local APIs to support extensibility within SAP S/HANA Public Cloud, but we also invested into the extension of our already existing OData (remote) APIs and added further operations. This enables you to build loosely coupled extensions on SAP BTP or in an own environment.

FIND OUT MORE!

An overview about the current and previous innovations for Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can be found in the List of "What's New" Presentations.

entry.title: SAP TM Report /SCMTMS/CHECK_ITEM_CONSISTENCY
entry.content:
SAP TM Report /SCMTMS/CHECK_ITEM_CONSISTENCY

Enhancement of SAP TM Item Consistency Check Report: Strengthening Data Integrity Through Advanced Validation

Introduction

The /SCMTMS/CHECK_ITEM_CONSISTENCY report serves as a critical data validation tool in SAP Transportation Management, ensuring the integrity of transportation-related items and business objects. As transportation operations become increasingly complex and data volumes grow, the need for comprehensive consistency checks has become paramount.

Current business challenges reveal significant gaps in item-level validation, particularly around duplicate ITEM_ID detection and automated correction capabilities. These inconsistencies can lead to planning errors, settlement discrepancies, and operational disruptions that impact the entire transportation process flow.

The enhancement initiative addresses these critical gaps by introducing advanced duplicate detection mechanisms and automated correction capabilities, transforming the report from a diagnostic tool into a comprehensive data quality management solution.

Current State Analysis

Existing Report Capabilities

The current /SCMTMS/CHECK_ITEM_CONSISTENCY report provides essential validation across TM item-level objects including freight units, transportation orders, and related documents. The report identifies missing or incorrect references between transportation items and their parent documents, detects orphaned data records lacking proper business object relationships, and verifies integrity of item-level master data assignments.

Key validation areas include:

  • Item-level object consistency across freight units and transportation orders
  • Parent-child relationship validation between items and documents
  • Status consistency checks between items and their business contexts
  • Quantity and business logic validations at the item level

Identified Gaps

Despite its comprehensive scope, the current implementation lacks critical validation capabilities:

Missing Duplicate ITEM_ID Detection: The report does not contain checks for duplicate ITEM_ID values within single freight documents, as confirmed by SAP Note 3055966. This gap can lead to processing errors and data integrity issues during transportation execution.

Limited Automated Correction: Current functionality focuses primarily on identification rather than resolution, requiring extensive manual intervention to address discovered inconsistencies.

Insufficient Hierarchy Validation: While basic item checks exist, comprehensive item hierarchy consistency validation requires enhancement, as addressed in SAP Note 2668639.

Enhancement Overview

Proposed Enhancements

  1. Duplicate ITEM_ID Detection

The enhancement introduces sophisticated duplicate detection logic that scans for identical ITEM_ID values within individual freight documents. The technical approach leverages optimized SQL queries with performance-conscious algorithms to identify duplicates without impacting system performance during large-scale validations.

Validation logic implementation includes:

  • Cross-table duplicate detection across TM item tables
  • Document-level grouping to ensure duplicates are identified within proper business contexts
  • Performance optimization through selective indexing and batch processing techniques
  1. Correction Report Introduction

A complementary correction report provides automated resolution capabilities for identified inconsistencies. The correction framework includes:

  • Automated Correction Capabilities: Pre-defined correction rules for common inconsistency patterns
  • Manual Correction Workflow: Guided correction processes for complex scenarios requiring business judgment
  • Rollback and Safety Mechanisms: Complete audit trails and rollback capabilities to ensure data safety during correction operations
  1. Extended Consistency Checks

Building on SAP Note 2668639, the enhancement extends validation coverage to include:

  • Item hierarchy consistency validation across multi-level transportation structures
  • Cross-reference validation between related TM objects
  • Enhanced data integrity checks covering previously unvalidated scenarios

Technical Implementation

Enhancement Framework

The implementation leverages SAP's enhancement framework through targeted modification of the existing report structure. Development approach utilizes implicit enhancement points within the report to maintain upgrade compatibility while extending functionality.

The correction report on architecture implements a three-tier approach:

  1. Detection Layer: Identifies inconsistencies using enhanced validation logic
  2. Analysis Layer: Categorizes inconsistencies and determines correction strategies
  3. Execution Layer: Applies corrections with comprehensive logging and rollback capabilities

Error handling mechanisms include transaction-safe processing, detailed error logging, and automatic rollback triggers for critical failures.

Key Features

Duplicate Detection Capabilities

Feature

Description

Benefit

Document-Level Scanning

Identify duplicate ITEM_IDs within individual freight documents

Prevents processing errors during transportation execution

Cross-Table Validation

Validates consistency across multiple TM item tables

Ensures comprehensive data integrity across the TM landscape

Performance Optimization

Batch processing with selective indexing

Maintains system performance during large-scale validations

Real-Time Alerts

Immediate notification of critical duplicates

Enables proactive issue resolution before business impact

Correction Mechanisms

Automated Correction Options: Pre-configured correction rules handle standard inconsistency patterns, including duplicate removal with business logic preservation, item hierarchy reconstruction, and reference relationship restoration.

Manual Review and Approval Process: Complex scenarios requiring business judgment are routed through structured approval workflows, ensuring business context is maintained during corrections.

Batch Processing Capabilities: Large-scale corrections can be processed in background jobs with comprehensive progress monitoring and error handling.

Implementation Guide

Prerequisites

System Requirements:

  • SAP TM 9.0 or higher with latest support packages
  • Sufficient system resources for batch processing operations
  • Database performance optimization for large item datasets

Authorization Requirements:

  • /SCMTMS/TOR and /SCMTMS/FU display and change authorizations
  • Background job scheduling permissions
  • Development and customization access for implementation

Development Steps

  1. Analysis and Design Phase: Comprehensive analysis of existing inconsistent patterns, design of correction algorithms, and definition of validation rules
  2. Code Development: Implementation of duplicate detection logic, correction report development, and integration with existing validation framework
  3. Testing and Validation: Unit testing of individual components, integration testing with existing TM processes, and performance validation with production-like data volumes
  4. Deployment and Go-Live: Phased rollout starting with development environment, comprehensive user training, and production deployment with monitoring

Configuration Requirements

Customization Settings: Configuration of correction rules, validation thresholds, and business-specific validation parameters through dedicated customization tables.

Parameter Configurations: System parameters for batch processing limits, performance optimization settings, and error handling thresholds.

User Role Assignments: Role-based access control for correction capabilities, approval workflows, and audit trail access.

Testing Strategy

Test Scenarios

Duplicate ITEM_ID Detection Testing: Comprehensive test scenarios covering single and multiple duplicate scenarios, edge cases with complex item hierarchies, and performance testing with large datasets.

Correction Functionality Validation: Testing of automated correction rules, manual correction workflows, and rollback mechanisms under various failure scenarios.

Performance and Volume Testing: Validation of system performance with production-scale data volumes, concurrent user scenarios, and batch processing optimization.

Benefits and Impact

Business Benefits

Improved Data Quality: Enhanced validation capabilities ensure higher data integrity across transportation processes, reducing downstream processing errors and improving operational reliability.

Reduced Manual Effort: Automated correction capabilities significantly reduce manual intervention requirements, freeing up resources for value-added activities.

Enhanced System Reliability: Comprehensive consistency checks improve overall system stability and reduce the risk of process failures during critical transportation operations.

Technical Benefits

Automated Inconsistency Resolution: Streamlined correction processes reduce the time required to resolve data quality issues from hours to minute.

Better Error Reporting: Enhanced logging and reporting capabilities provide detailed insights into data quality trends and correction effectiveness.

Streamlined Maintenance Processes: Integrated correction capabilities reduce the complexity of ongoing system maintenance and data quality management.

Best Practices

Development Guidelines

Coding Standards: Adherence to SAP development standards, comprehensive documentation, and modular design principles ensure maintainability and upgrade compatibility.

Performance Optimization: Implementation of efficient algorithms, selective data processing, and optimized database access patterns maintain system performance during validation operations.

Error Handling Best Practices: Comprehensive error handling, transaction safety, and detailed logging ensure robust operation under all conditions.

Operational Recommendations

Execution Frequency: Regular execution during maintenance windows, triggered validation after major data changes, and continuous monitoring for critical inconsistencies.

Monitoring and Alerting: Integration with system monitoring tools, automated alerting for critical issues, and dashboard reporting for data quality metrics.

Potential Challenges

Technical Challenges

Performance Impact on Large Datasets: Processing millions of transportation items requires careful optimization to avoid system performance degradation.

Complex Correction Scenarios: Some inconsistencies may require sophisticated business logic to resolve correctly without impacting ongoing operations.

Mitigation Strategies

Performance Optimization Techniques: Implementation of parallel processing, selective data loading, and optimized database queries ensure acceptable performance even with large datasets.

Phased Implementation Approach: Gradual rollout of correction capabilities allows fine-tuning and optimization based on real-world usage patterns.

Future Enhancements

Roadmap Considerations

Future development phases will include additional consistency checks for advanced TM scenarios, integration with other TM validation reports, and real-time validation capabilities during data entry processes.

Scalability Planning: Architecture designed to support increasing data volumes, multi-client environments, and cloud deployment scenarios ensures long-term viability.

Conclusion

The enhancement to the /SCMTMS/CHECK_ITEM_CONSISTENCY report represents a significant advancement in SAP TM data quality management. By introducing duplicate ITEM_ID detection and automated correction capabilities, organizations can achieve higher data integrity, reduce manual effort, and improve operational reliability.

The comprehensive approach addresses current gaps while providing a foundation for future enhancements, ensuring that transportation data quality management keeps pace with evolving business requirements. Implementation of these enhancements will transform the report from a diagnostic tool into a comprehensive data quality management solution, delivering measurable benefits in operational efficiency and system reliability.

Organizations planning to implement these enhancements should prioritize thorough testing, phased rollout, and comprehensive user training to maximize the benefits while minimizing implementation risks. The investment in enhanced data quality capabilities will pay dividends through improved operational efficiency and reduced maintenance overhead.

 

Refer:

3053013

Enhancement to check report /SCMTMS/CHECK_ITEM_CONSISTENCY

3195231

Collection of SAP Notes to help root cause analysis

3325446

Freight Order not available for invoicing in LBN

3055966

Enhancement in Item Consistency Check Report /SCMTMS/CHECK_ITEM_CONSISTENCY: Check for duplicate ITEM_ID

2675213

Introduce Correction Report for TOR Item Inconsistencies

2668639

Extend Item consistency check report

1990249

Analyze report for the detection of erroneous Items in Freight Orders/Bookings

 Hope that can help you.

Thanks, and regards

Rogerio Lima.

entry.title: Looking for Expert and Community Insights on My SAP Technical Journey
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I hope you are all doing well.

I would like to kindly ask for your feedback and professional insights regarding my current learning journey within the SAP Technical domain. My goal is to continuously improve my technical profile and ensure that my learning path aligns well with real-world SAP projects and current market expectations.

Below is a brief overview of my learning direction and the reasoning behind each focus area.


SAP Technical Learning Direction At this stage, my primary focus is on pursuing the SAP Technical track. I am currently concentrating on SAP Basis, aiming to build a strong and solid foundation in SAP system administration, core architecture, and operational concepts.
In parallel, I am expanding my knowledge across several complementary technical areas, as outlined below:


SAP HANA
My objective is to gain a clear and comprehensive understanding of SAP HANA database architecture and how SAP systems interact with the database layer in terms of structure, performance optimization, and system integration.


SAP ABAP
I am working on building a solid understanding of the ABAP stack, with a focus on how development processes are designed and implemented within SAP systems. This helps me better understand system logic, debugging, and collaboration with development teams from a technical perspective.


SAP CPI (Cloud Integration)
My focus includes understanding SAP’s transition from traditional on-premise environments to cloud-based platforms, along with cloud integration concepts such as internal (A2A) and external (B2B) integration scenarios.

Additionally, I have complemented this learning path with the Apache Camel Framework, due to its importance and relevance within SAP integration solutions.


SAP UI5 / Fiori & SAP BTP CAPM
Recently, SAP introduced important updates related to both frontend and backend development models. I have been exploring these updates and following commonly recommended learning resources to better understand the modern SAP development approach, including CAP-based application development.


Learning Approach
Overall, I am intentionally following a structured and methodical learning sequence to build a holistic understanding of SAP Architecture as an integrated enterprise platform, rather than focusing on individual tools or isolated technologies.


Current Learning Path & Courses
Below are the main courses I am currently following (via Udemy):

SAP NetWeaver Fundamentals

SAP Basis Administration

SAP HANA Administration

Apache Camel Framework with Spring Boot

SAP Cloud Integration (CI / CPI), including API Management and Event Mesh

SAP UI5 / Fiori Full Stack with TypeScript / JavaScript using SAP BTP RAPM / CAPM


I would truly appreciate your feedback on whether this learning path is well-structured and aligned with real-world SAP implementations, and whether there are any key areas you would recommend adding, adjusting, or prioritizing differently.

Thank you in advance for your time and valuable insights.

Best regards,

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM Introduces a "Feature Preview" Approach
entry.content:
SAP Cloud ALM is rolling out a new approach to feature releases. This approach provides users with an early look at what's coming. Currently, only some selected functional areas offer this preview window. The Preview window is approximately two weeks before features officially go live in the regular Wednesday feature delivery cycle.

The features will be marked as “Preview” in the SAP Cloud ALM What’s New page:

 

 

The goal is to provide this “Preview” information 2 weeks (one development sprint) before the feature is released. It can happen in some exceptional cases that the feature will be in “Preview” for 4 weeks or more.

 

## What This Means for Users

 

This preview approach provides customers with better visibility into upcoming functionality, : 

  • Plan for new capabilities ahead of time
  • Assess the potential impacts and benefits of new features on their existing processes.
  • Prepare training materials and documentation for better end-user adoption
  • Adjust workflows to incorporate new features

Partners can also leverage this information to prepare the adoption of these new features for their customers.

 

## Where to Find Previewed Features

 

All previewed features are accessible through the What's New Viewer on SAP Help Portal. You can check what's coming at: https://help.sap.com/whats-new/0cb91c1ef73b400f881823f8d5fd2dea

 

## Current Scope

 

It's worth noting that this preview capability isn't available across the entire SAP Cloud ALM platform yet—it's currently limited to . As this process matures, we expand it gradually to all SAP Cloud ALM functional areas.

 

This initiative reflects SAP's commitment to transparency and helping customers stay ahead of changes in their SAP Cloud ALM tenants. For teams managing complex SAP landscapes, having that extra two-week window can make a real difference in adoption and change management.

 Don’t hesitate to like this post if you think that this feature is useful for you.

entry.title: Re: entries of 2l and ol ledger difference
entry.content:
Hi @jerrysam ,

based on what you are writing, I would assume it is most probably a difference due to rounding differences. You said that you are doing an analysis on account level. In this case, multiple different materials might be the source for the difference. You can drill down further with the apps Material Inventory Values - Balance Summary and Material Inventory Values - Line Items to find the true source of the delta. The price unit should ideally be the same in different ledgers, especially if there is no good reason for it. This can easily lead to rounding differences in postings.

If you just want to see the same value in both ledgers, you can also manually adjust the material price to be identical which will also trigger a revaluation posting to correct the inventory value. This will of course not solve the root cause of any deltas. Please keep in mind that manual setting of the material price will overwrite any cost component split for the material.

I hope this help. I don't think I can really analyze it any better without access to the system. If you need further clarification for which you need someone looking at the system directly, you may also open a ticket.

Best regards
Marvin

entry.title: Re: How to use Custom Logic App to pass Contract Header d...
entry.content:
HI @bigflatfoot,

There is usually no process to update already created follow-up documents if the source document is changed.
I do see two potential workarounds:

1. Update via local event handler:
You could implement a local event handler for the I_SalesContract~changed event. In that implementation you could check for open sales orders with reference to the changed contract and update the order accordingly. One limitation here would be that it will not work if the order is currently locked by another user for example. You can find further details about local event consumption here.

2. Update via Custom Application job:
You could check regularly for updated Contracts an update the follow up sales orders. You can find further details about custom application jobs here. The limitation here is that it will not work immediately after the contract has been changed.

You could also think about a solution which combines the two approaches.

entry.title: HANA Cloud: Inconsistent Network Egress Consumption
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

First, here's some context: we're making use of BTP with the Cloud Foundry Runtime with AWS as our backing hyperscaler and our primary persistent is HANA Cloud.

For the problem: Towards the end of 2025, we noticed some peculiar behavior with regards to network egress in our HANA Cloud instance. We had a very stable level of network egress consumption between January and September 2025 but in October and November we saw this consumption nearly double before receding to more baseline levels in December. 

There are two problems with these changes in consumption levels:

  1. We had no discernable code changes that correlate to the increases beginning in October OR the decrease that began in December
  2. December is by far our highest volume month in terms of database use which is inconsistent with it returning to normal levels of network egress consumption

While this was initially discovered by looking at global account level consumption statistics, it was confirmed within the HANA Cloud dashboards themselves AND the metering and metrics APIs (as described here: Metering Metrics).

Our leading theory into why we see these random jumps is due to how Availability Zones (AZs) are handled within BTP. HANA Cloud instances very clearly have an AZ visible in HANA Cloud Central. In our particular case that zone is us-east-1b.

App instances are another case entirely though. SAP has published a note on the question (3476931 - Is it possible to get Availability Zone for BTP Cloud Foundry application?) which states the following as its resolution:

SAP controls the AZ of Cloud Foundry applications to ensure availability. It is not necessary/needed that customers know/manage the AZ for custom applications. 

This clearly indicates the actual AZ of app instances is out of control of customers. This reveals a potential problem though given that the underlying hyperscaler AWS charges for network traffic between distinct AZs in the same region. If we take these facts together:

  1. HANA Cloud is deployed in a particular AZ
  2. App instances are deployed in AZs under the control of SAP
  3. AWS charges for network data transfers across AZs

That would indicate that customers are open to seemingly random increases in network egress consumption based on how app instances are deployed and they have no means of controlling that. 

Now, there is a note (3443501 - HANA Cloud overage costs) that states managing network consumption is not SAP's responsibility, but given what we know about AZs, this seems customers lack the tools to adequately manage these costs.

The question: Given what we know, has anyone else experienced similar issues and how did you get this type of consumption under control? We really seem to be at a loss for this and these increase in consumption are non-trivial.

I appreciate any insights on the matter.

Thanks,

Brian

entry.title: How is the sales area determined on sales order inbound EDI processing
entry.content:
This blog aims to explain how the sales area is determined by the system during sales order creation when receiving it through EDI.

When the system cannot determine the sales area through any of the options, the error message "Sales area cannot be determined" can be found.

The following configuration activities are used to map business partners in supplier side and determine sales area/document type. They are essential for the system to be able to determine the sales area correctly.

  • Convert External to Internal Partner Numbers (101300)
  • Assign Customer/Supplier to Sales Organization Data (101337)

The sales order is determined by the system by following the bellow options:

1. Directly from the payload

If the sales area details are specified within the payload, then the system takes directly this sales area. Example in the payload:
<Order>
.........
       <SalesDocumentType>TA</SalesDocumentType>
       <SalesOrganization>1010</SalesOrganization>
       <OrganizationDivision>00</OrganizationDivision>
       <DistributionChannel>10</DistributionChannel>
........
</Order>

Receiving this payload, the system will determine the sales area 1010/00/10. If these fields are not present in the payload, then the system checks for the next option.

2. CPF framework determination

When a sales document is created or changed, the system can evaluate specific fields in the inbound EDI message to dynamically determine the sales area, sales document types, and discrepancy allowance for payment terms for the sales document to be updated or created. Configurable Parameters & Formulas (CPF) framework allow customers to dynamically define business rules to determine EDI required information based on data what is provided by buyer. 

For more information on how to use CPF flexible determination for sales area, follow the documentation bellow:

  • S/4HANA Q2C Sales Flexibility – Determine Business Partner and Sales Area in B2B EDI Integration | SAP Community
  • Flexible Determination of Sales Area and Sales Document Types | SAP Help Portal

If the CPF formulas are not implemented, then the system will try to determine the sales area based on the next and last option.

3. Determined by the customer number

Using the following payload as an example:

<Party PartyType="SoldTo">
       <BuyerPartyID></BuyerPartyID>
</Party>
<Party PartyType="Supplier">
       <SupplierPartyID></SupplierPartyID>
       <BuyerPartyID></BuyerPartyID>
</Party>

The vendor number will be determined by following this priority:

  1. SupplierPartyID from "Supplier" Party
  2. BuyerPartyID from "Supplier" Party
  3. BuyerPartyID from "SoldTo" Party

After fetching this vendor number, the system will look for this vendor number in the configuration activity 'Assign Customer/Supplier to Sales Organization Data' (101337) and will fetch the sales area maintained there.
Note: this configuration activity is editable in all systems, this means it's not transportable, so you need to maintain it in every relevant system.

Summary

The system provides different ways of determining the sales area: directly (from the payload), flexibly (CPF) or indirectly (vendor number). If the system cannot determine the sales area through these 3 ways, the error "Sales area cannot be determined" is thrown. Then, you must revisit you configurations and payload to check if you're providing at least one of the options for the system to determine the sales area correctly.

entry.title: SAP Business One 10.0 (HANA/SQL) – Multiple phantom sessions/windows appearing when switching tabs
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We are observing unusual UI behavior in SAP Business One 10.0 regarding session window management. I would appreciate any insights or references to relevant SAP Notes.

Problem Description: While only a single user session is active, the application appears to redundantly multiply its presence in the OS task switcher (Alt+Tab view) whenever focus is shifted between SAP B1 and external applications (e.g., Excel, Chrome,.etc.).

Technical Details:

  • Version: SAP Business One 10.0 (HANA).

  • Observed Behavior: Each time a user toggles focus (Alt+Tab) or switches between internal SAP modules, a new "phantom" window instance appears in the task switcher, despite no additional sessions being initiated.

  • Environment: SAP Client

  • Impact: This creates significant navigation clutter and makes it difficult for users to identify the active window.

Has anyone encountered this ghosting effect in Version 10? We are currently investigating whether this is a Client-side rendering bug, a display scaling issue, or specific to the RDS environment.

Best regards,

Sunil Patil

Certified SAP Business One Consultant

entry.title: Re: Open Items using plant and company code as separate b...
entry.content:
Hello @Anja_1 

Thank you for your question

The description you provided hints at the fact that your partner determination is using the wrong partner role for billing and that explains your test results. In public cloud, for intercompany setup, it is normal for you to have:

  • One Business Partner assigned to the company code (this is used for internal payer and FI receivables and payment settlement)
  • The other Business Partner assigned to the plant (used mainly as the ship to party for your logistics, so the correct receiving site address and shipping data are used)

So basically, this means, it is not correct to use the Business Partner as payer or bill to because then you can end up with open item on an account that represents your own legal entity or you split the open items across different customer accounts.

Step 1: So why does SAP use BP for plant and another for compan code?

The Plant Business Partner is used to represent the physical receiving or delivering location in logistics. This enables correct ship to determination and shipping data. That means assigning a business partner to a plant in configuration is explicitly supported. See https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0864cb07010642b3bde45a20de4975bc/229f7b7fea6b4ce78ce9b44a9735cbd6.html for more details.

The Company code BP is used to represent legal entity for intercompany settlement. The public cloud only allows you to do a one-to-one mapping (one BP per company code). See https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/61e246f4b34c4e1790d8b7651c0b40a8/5c5452a48916497e8b25dc84b5ec19e8.html for more details.

The intercompany billing expectation focuses on billing intercompany invoices to the internal payer you have assigned to the selling sales organisation and not to the plant BP. See https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a376cd9ea00d476b96f18dea1247e6a5/64176584d24d4db2b953bb32bfbb9f63.html for more details.

Step 2: Potential issues with your setup based on you screenshots:

In your first screenshot, the plant BP looks extended as a full customer for its own sales area with partner functions that make it behave like sold to, bill to, payer and ship to all in one. That set up often explains why you get posting to multiple customer numbers for the same partner and it can also cause “self open items”.

A clean core standard design is usually:

  • Sold to, bill to or payer should be the company code customer BP of the intercompany partner or,
  • Ship to can be that the plant BP of the receiving plant.

If you use ship to as a payer or bill to, then FI will post your receivable to the plant BP customer, which is not what finance expects.

 

Here is a step-by-step guide to consider:

Step A: First you need to confirm which BP is used in your intercompany billing document. For that open Display Billing Documents, enter your credit memo or intercompany invoice billing doc. number.

Open the document, click on the Display Document Flow

and confirm you are in the intercompany step. Open the document header to confirm sold to, bill to, payer and ship to. The payer should equal the company code BP customer and ship to must equals the plant BP.

Step B: is to check and correct the plant BP functions. For that open Maintain BP

Open the plant BP, switch to customer role, go to Sales and Distribution data

and open the partner functions tab. Then set ship to can remain in plant BP. Sold to, bill to, payer should be set to the company code BP customer and not the plant BP. See Maintain Business Partner for more details.

Step C is to verify your plant to BP assignment is correct. For that open your configuration environment. Select the receiving plant and confirm the assigned BP is the correct plant BP. See Assigning Business Partner to Plant for more insights.

Step D is to verify company cod to BP assignment is correct. Check your mapping for each company code and confirm the company code that should be the intercompany partner is mapped to the correct BP. See Assign Business Partners to Company Codes for more details.

If you see open items in the same company code against a customer that represents (see Intercompany Billing) the same legal entity, then this could be caused by:

  1. The payer in the billing document is incorrectly the plant BP or a BP mapped to the same company code
  2. Your internal payer determination is pointing to the wrong BP

To summarise:

  • Plant BP is for logistics ship to while company code BP is for legal entity settlement.
  • Note that intercompany billing bills to internal payer, so payer should be the compan code BP customer and not the plant BP.
  • Your screenshots suggest that plant BP is acting a payer and bill to and that explains why you have the split open items and the Self open item effect.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Enabling Geofencing Mobile Clock in Clock Out- SuccessFactors Time Tracking
entry.content:
Guide to Configure Geofencing in SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking (Latest Release)

Introduction

With the latest SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking enhancements, Geofencing has been introduced to improve accuracy and compliance in Clock In / Clock Out scenarios.

Geofencing ensures that employees can record their working time only when they are physically present at an approved work location, using mobile GPS validation.

This blog explains how to configure Geofencing from scratch, in simple and practical steps, especially helpful for EC Time Management consultants.

What is Geofencing in Simple Words?

          Geofencing is a virtual boundary created around a work location (office, factory, site, etc.).

If an employee is inside the boundary, they can Clock In / Clock Out

If they are outside, the system blocks the time punch

📌This works only on the SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App using GPS location.

  • Business Benefits
  • Prevents incorrect or fraudulent time entries
  • Ensures employees clock time from approved locations
  • Improves audit and compliance
  • Ideal for factories, retail stores, site workers, and field staff

Prerequisites

  1. Before starting configuration, ensure the following:
  2. Employee Central Time Management is enabled
  3. Time Tracking (Clock In / Clock Out) is already working
  4. SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App is enabled
  5. Required admin and employee permissions are granted

Configuration Steps

Step 1: Check Time Tracking Configuration

Navigate to:

Admin Center → Time Management Configuration

Ensure:

Time Tracking is enabled

Clock In / Clock Out is configured

A Time Recording Profile exists

Step 2: Enable Mobile Access

Geofencing works only on mobile.

Navigate to:

Admin Center → Mobile Settings

Ensure:

SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App is enabled

Location services are allowed

Step 3: Create or Verify Location

Geofencing is linked to a Location object.

Navigate to:

Admin Center → Manage Organization, Pay and Job Structures → Location

Create or edit a location with:

Accurate address

Country

Latitude & Longitude (auto-filled)

📌Correct address is critical for GPS accuracy.

Step 4: Create Geofence

Enable permission:

Navigate to:

Admin Center → Manage Data

Search for: Geofence

Click Create New

Fill in:

Geofence Name (example: Chennai Fence)

Status: Active

Shape Type:

Circle (recommended for beginners)

Polygon (advanced custom shape)

Use the map to draw the boundary around the workplace and save.

Step 5: Assign Geofence to Configure Clock in Clock out groups

Navigate to:

Admin Center → Manage Data → Configure Clock in Clock out groups

Save

Step 6: Enable Geofence Validation for Time Events

Navigate to:

Admin Center → Time Management Configuration

Open the relevant Time Recording Profile

Enable:

Validate Clock In by Geofence

Validate Clock Out by Geofence

(Optional)

Exclude break events if required

Save the configuration.

Step 7: Assign Profiles to Employees

Navigate to:

Admin Center → Manage Data → Job Information

Ensure employees have:

Correct Location assigned

Correct Time Recording Profile

Without this mapping, geofencing will not work.

Step 8: Employee Mobile Setup

Employees must:

  • Install SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App
  • Allow Precise Location – Always Allow
  • Use Clock In / Clock Out from mobile

📌Desktop time recording does not support geofencing.

Testing Scenarios

1. Outside Geofence Location: When accessing the Clock In/Out tab in the mobile app while outside the geofenced area, the punch options were greyed out, indicating that the user is outside the allowed area for time tracking.


2. Within Geofence: As configured when user is in meters range of the location configured, Clock In/Out becomes active. The user can successfully clock in and out.

Other Scenarios:

Inside geofence : Clock In allowed ✅

Outside geofence: Clock In blocked ❌

GPS disabled: Time entry blocked ❌

Common Issues & Tips

Testing on desktop → ❌ Not supported

Incorrect location address → ❌ GPS mismatch

Mobile location permission set to “While using app” → ❌

VPN or mock GPS apps → ❌

Conclusion

Geofencing in SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking is a powerful feature that ensures location-based time compliance.

When configured correctly, it significantly improves time accuracy and prevents misuse.

This feature is especially useful for:

Manufacturing units

Retail stores

On-site project teams

Field workforce

Hope my blog was useful for many consultants. Will be back with new blog. Stay Tuned!

Regards, 
Aravind R
SAP HXM Consultant

entry.title: Exploring the SAP Signavio Process Manager API Part 2: Reading Directories and Process Diagrams
entry.content:
👉Read Part 1: Getting Started with SAP Signavio Process Manager API

 

Intro

In the first post of this series, we looked at how to get started with the SAP Signavio Process Manager API. Once you start working with the API, a number of practical use cases open up, such as: 

  • Custom reporting on processes, diagrams, or tasks, for example to track ownership, changes, or completeness 
  • Replicating processes and relationships to external tools such as GRC systems, data catalogs, or Enterprise Architecture Management tools 
  • Extending SAP Signavio Process Manager functionality through API-based integrations, for example for translations or automated documentation. 

All of these scenarios start with the same foundation: Being able to read your workspace structure and access process diagrams programmatically.

 

In this post, we’ll: 
  • Read the structure of your workspace 
  • Navigate through folders and subfolders 
  • List process diagrams and their key attributes (title, created, updated, ID, folder) 
  • Export diagrams as PNG files and JSON to access attributes from the BPMN model 

 

With the help of the following APIs: 
  • Directory API to explore folders and list diagrams (SAP Business Accelerator Hub (SAP BAH), SAP Help) 
  • Model API to access model details (SAP BAH, SAP Help) 
  • Import and Export API to export diagrams as PNG and JSON files (SAP BAH, SAP Help) 

By the end, you’ll have everything you need to generate a simple inventory of your workspace, along with a visual snapshot or a JSON representation of each diagram. 

 

Understanding the Directory API

If you’ve ever opened the Explorer in SAP Signavio Process Manager, you know the basic structure:

  • Shared Documents,
  • My Documents,
  • Trash,
  • Dictionary / Glossary 

SPM

The Directory API gives you the same structure in JSON. It’s the starting point for everything else and the endpoints follow the same base scheme: 

👉https://{baseUrl}/spm/v1/directory 

 

Note: Base URL depends on your region (find the regions here). For a complete and up-to-date overview of all endpoints and parameters, refer to the SAP Signavio Process Manager API Guide and the API documentation on SAP BAH.

Every request needs: 

  • x-signavio-id: your JWT authentication token 
  • Cookie: JSESSIONID={jsessionId}:  the session cookie from the auth response 
  • Accept: application/json

You can find a step-by-step Guide on authentication in this blog post. 

Note: If those headers are missing or wrong, you’ll fairly quickly run into 403 or 423 errors, especially if SSO is enforced and the technical user isn’t set up correctly. Learn more on SAP Help.

 

Retrieving the Root Folders

Let’s start with the top level. 

👉GET /spm/v1/directory 

This returns a list of resources, usually three folders plus one dictionary entry: 

  • rel: "dir" with type: "public" → Shared Documents 
  • rel: "dir" with type: "private" → My Documents 
  • rel: "dir" with type: "trash" → Trash 
  • rel: "glos" → link to the Dictionary 

 

A few things to note: 
  • The folder ID is hidden inside href (/directory/{id}) 
  • Type differentiates public/private/trash only at root level 
  • You already get metadata like name, created, visible, deleted 

To explore what’s inside these folders, the Directory API provides href references that point to the next level of the folder structure. 

 

Navigating Folders and Reading Their Contents 

To explore what’s inside a folder, call: 

👉GET /spm/v1/directory/{id} 

This returns a JSON array with several different rel types, such as: 

  • rel: "info" → metadata about this folder 
  • rel: "parents" → all ancestor folders 
  • rel: "dir" → subfolders 
  • rel: "mod" → diagrams contained in this folder 

... and more.

 

Two key object types for us: 
  • Subfolder: rel:"dir" → follow href (/directory/{id}) to go deeper 
  • Diagram: rel:"mod" → href contains the diagram ID (/model/{id}), and rep contains useful attributes 

You can build a complete view of your folder tree and collect all diagrams along the way using only the Directory API. 

 

How to collect all diagram IDs from the workspace 

At this point, you might be thinking: that’s great, but my workspace has dozens or hundreds of diagrams. I don’t want to manually follow each folder and copy every ID one by one. 

This is where a recursive traversal comes in. Since folders can be nested arbitrarily deep, your script starts at the root folders, follows every rel = "dir"  entry, and calls GET /directory/{id} for each subfolder. This step is repeated until no further subfolders are found. Diagrams (rel = "mod") can be collected at each level during this traversal. 

This recursive logic is straightforward to implement in a script and allows you to reliably discover all folders and diagrams, regardless of how deeply they are nested. 

 

Reading Diagram Metadata from the Directory API 

 For many reporting scenarios, you don’t need a dedicated “diagram API” to read attributes like title, created date, or folder. For a lightweight “landscape report”, you can map entries returned by the Directory API like this: 

  • Diagram ID → "href", for example /model/fea8a2ac6d184bf2852ecbaa11622a51 (last part) 
  • Title → "name" 
  • Created → "created" 
  • Last updated → "updated" 
  • Diagram type → "type" (for example BPMN, process map, DMN) 
  • Folder → "parentName" and "parent" 
  • Description → "description" (if maintained) 

For many scenarios, this level of metadata is enough. But as soon as you want to understand relationships between elements, work with custom attributes, inspect BPMN content and shapes, or generate visual representations of diagrams (such as PNG exports), you need access to the model itself. That’s where the next step comes in. 

 

Accessing Model Content and Exporting Visual Representations (JSON, PNG) 

Once you have a list of diagrams and their IDs, the next step is often to retrieve the actual model content or a visual representation of the diagram.

You can export the latest revision of a diagram in different formats (see the API documentation and SAP BAH for the complete list), for example: 

  • PNG → Useful if you need a visual snapshot of the diagram, for example for documentation or reports. 

👉GET /spm/v1/model/{id}/png   

 

  • JSON  →  Useful if you want to access the underlying model content, including elements (for example BPMN shapes such as tasks) and custom attributes. 

👉GET /spm/v1/model/{id}/json

 

In future blog posts, we’ll explore how to extract specific attributes and relationships directly from the process model using the JSON export.  

 

Common Pitfalls and Tips 

 

Token validity and authentication 

  • The token stays valid for 8 hours. After that, you simply repeat the same request to get a fresh one. You can find more details in SAP Help. 
  • Using a technical user with the API Edition license helps avoid SSO-related redirects and ensures API access without consuming UI licenses. For more information on access and licensing, view SAP Help. 

And if you want a quick refresher, I’ve also walked through the steps in the first blog post. 

Permissions and HTTP errors 

  • 403 (Forbidden) usually means “access denied”. The user doesn’t have permission to open that folder or diagram. Double-check workspace access rights and assigned roles. 
  • 404 (Not Found) means the referenced folder or diagram doesn’t exist, or it isn’t accessible in the current workspace. 
  • Responses like redirects or 423 errors are often caused by missing or incorrect headers. Make sure your requests explicitly include Accept: application/json and that you’re using the correct authentication setup, as described in the API documentation. 

Performance and rate limits 

The APIs enforce rate limits to protect the system.  At the time of writing, the following limit applies: 

  • Rate limit: up to 50 requests per 60 seconds
⚠️ Note: Since this limit may change over time, always refer to the official API documentation for the most up-to-date values.

 

Best Practices

When working with larger workspaces, it’s important not to send too many API requests too quickly. For example, looping through hundreds of folders or diagrams with one request right after another can hit rate or concurrency limits faster than you’d expect. 

To keep things running smoothly, these best practices can help: 

  • Reuse results where possible 
    If you run scripts repeatedly, save folder IDs or previous responses and reuse them, instead of loading the whole workspace again every time. 
  • Slow down large request runs 
    When exporting or analyzing many diagrams, add small pauses between calls or process items in smaller batches rather than all at once. 

If your workspace is very large, it can also help to narrow down what you scan: 

  • Start from specific root folders 
    For example, begin with one business area instead of searching through the entire workspace. 
  • Use naming conventions or folder structures 
    This makes it easier to focus only on the relevant parts and skip everything you don’t need. 

  

Wrapping Up  

💡In this post, we focused on understanding what is actually stored in an SAP Signavio Process Manager workspace and how to access it via API. By combining the APIs , you can traverse folders, list diagrams, extract metadata, and retrieve both visual and structured representations of your processes. This provides a reliable basis for building inventories, reports, or integrations that need an up-to-date view of your process landscape. 

⏭In a follow-up post, we’ll take a closer look at how to extract specific attributes and relationships directly from the process model using the JSON representation. Stay tuned! 

You have questions or feedback? Contact Us!

📫 signavio_ecosystem@sap.com

entry.title: Introducing the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit
entry.content:
Focus of this blog:

  • Introduction
  • How the UI Kit is set up
  • How to get the UI Kit
  • How to use the UI Kit
  • Essential Ressources

 

Introduction

The new SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit is a high-fidelity Figma kit specifically designed for creating dashboards in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories. It closely reflects Stories UI elements and is based on the SAP Fiori Morning Horizon theme.

The UI Kit includes ready-to-use dashboard templates with placeholder or example data, charts, and other UI controls. Designers can easily switch between templates, swap visualization types, and adapt dashboards as requirements evolve. This accelerates the design process while supporting a seamless transition from mock-ups to implementation and ensuring consistent results across projects.

👉 Download the UI Kit from GitHub

 

Why Use the SAC Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit?

  • Efficiency: Reduce repetitive design efforts with pre-built components, saving time and resources.
  • High-Fidelity Mockups: Design detailed and realistic dashboards that closely reflect the SAP Analytics Cloud capabilities.
  • Consistency: Adhere to established design standards to produce a cohesive look across various dashboards, enhancing overall user experience.

 

 

How the UI Kit is set up

The UI Kit consists of three pages for easy navigation and use.

The first page, “📓 Cover“, is a UI Kit overview that includes a cover, and a slide explaining the purpose and usage of the UI Kit, as well as semantic versioning.

"Cover" Page of the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit

The second page, “✏️ Analytical Pages”, provides dashboard templates. Depending on the purpose of your dashboard, you can choose to use different BI page types, or start with an empty page to design your dashboard from scratch.

"Analytical Pages" page of the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit

The third page, “✏️ Components”, contains all other assets: UI elements and controls, containers and different chart types available in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories.

"Components" page of the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit

 

How to get the UI Kit

  1. Navigate to the "SAC Fiori Horizon Theme" folder on GitHub.

  2. Open the file "SAC_Hi-Fi_Dashboard_UI_Kit.fig".
    Open the "SAC Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit" Figma File from GitHub
  3. Click on the Download button.
    Download the "SAC Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit" Figma File from GitHub

  4. Open the downloaded file in Figma. Choose a destination folder, and you're ready to go.

 

 

How to use the UI Kit

After importing the file, we suggest making the UI Kit available within your company's Figma space. This allows you to utilize Figma’s Library feature effectively. Depending on your settings, this setup enables either just your immediate team or your entire organization to access the UI Kit via the asset panel, fostering seamless collaboration and ensuring consistent design practices across your teams.
To share a UI Kit, head to the File Settings, and click on “Publish Library...”. Choose the components you wish to include and decide who should have access to the UI Kit. Then click on "Publish" to complete the process.


Note: This feature is not available if the file has been moved to your Drafts.

"Publish library..." menu option in Figma

You can now incorporate the SAP Analytics Cloud Dashboard Hi-Fi UI Kit into your files via the libraries dialog, making all components conveniently accessible from the assets panel.

entry.title: Re: Need to know how can Return Revenue GL can be assigne...
entry.content:
Hello @abulhasnat

You are correct to challenge the different pricing procedure point. In many tenants OR and CBAR/CBRE can share the same Document Pricing Procedure (for example Y1), so you cannot isolate returns by swapping pricing procedures. You still have two standard ways to achieve a different revenue GL for the return credit memo as mentioned earlier.

Basically saying, you cannot derive a different revenue GL “directly by return order type” because account determination keys do not use CBAR/CBRE as a direct criterion.

In public cloud, you can solve it by either:

  • Using a return pricing condition with a different account key and exclusion, so only the return condition applies, then map that key to the return GL or
  • Adding a custom field to Revenue Account Determination and populating it during billing so the return credit memo derives a different GL.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Switch to the new mass apps for business partner master data on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition!
entry.content:
Do you still use the deprecated apps for mass load and mass maintenance for business partners on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition? It is now to benefit from the successor apps and prepare your environment before the old apps will be removed. This post provides you with more information and details on how to make the switch.

⚠️Important This activity must be completed before the deprecated apps are no longer available! This is planned for release 2608.

 

Why should I switch?

The new apps are enhanced in several dimensions:

  • Useability is enhanced with a new dialog to start a mass change process that allows you to more flexibly define the selection criteria. Selection criteria can now be reviewed and refined from the top of the page. Overall, this makes working with the app more intuitive.
  • Using data from a file for a mass change or mass load is now directly possible from the aforementioned dialog.
  • These 2 changes make the Manage Mass Maintenance app the central point to start mass processes. No need for the separate Tile Start Mass Processing.
  • The new version of the app provides additional process attributes, such as due date.
  • Customers with the additional license for SAP Master Data Governance can now display each business partner in the app Manage Business Partner – Central Governance, providing a single view on the complete business partner (see Additional Scope Items below).
  • Finally, the new version offers the most recent user experience and generic features of SAP Fiori, for example to collaborate with other users

What must I do?

There are 3 basic steps for making the switch happen:

  1. Activate the feature Successor MDG apps for business partners (MDC_BP_CLOUD_READY).
  2. Remove the deprecated Business Catalogs and assign the successor Business Catalogs from business role template Master Data Specialist - Business Partner Data (SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST).
  3. Finalize the procedure by starting the app Export Master Data - Business Partners (Fiori ID F6551A) and export any selection of business partners (at least one).
    Important: This is a mandatory step that completes technical setting to enable all new apps!

In case you need more detailed instructions, here they are:

More Detailed Instructions

How to activate the feature?

Follow the documentation Activate Features to find the correct configuration environment according to your system landscape. Eventually, you will find the item Basic Settings and launch this item.

This leads you to the activity Activate Features. Search for the feature Successor MDG apps for business partners (MDC_BP_CLOUD_READY) and activate it. Note: The feature is not reversible, so please test your processes before activating in your production tenant!

How to change the business role for my users?

Examine the business role that you use for your master data specialists using the app Maintain Business Roles. On tab Business Catalogs you will find the two catalogs Mass Load - Business Partner Master (Deprecated) (SAP_CMD_BC_BP_MASSLOAD_PC) and Mass Maintenance - Business Partner Master (Deprecated) (SAP_CMD_BC_BP_MASSMAINT_PC). Note that both of them are marked as deprecated.

Remove these catalogs form the business role. Instead, add the catalog Master Data Governance - Mass Maintenance for Business Partners (SAP_CMD_BC_BPCS_MAINT_PC).

You can also use the function Manage Changes After Upgrade that becomes visible once you switch the business role to edit mode.

If your business role is based on the business role template Master Data Specialist - Business Partner Data (SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST), you can also use the app Business Role Templates to compare and adjust the role.

How to finalize with the export?

It is important to finalize the switch procedure by performing an arbitrary selection of business partners, at least one. Launch the app Export Master Data - Business Partners (Fiori ID F6551A). For example, in the section Define Scope enter BUT000 in the field Select Tables, then enter a business partner number that will select at least one business partner. Also make sure that not too many are selected to avoid spending too much time. After that press Export and if you are satisfied with selected number of business partners, once more Export. There is no need to download the file. It is only important that the export completes.

Done!

You should now be able to use the new app Manage Mass Maintenance – BP (Fiori ID F7974) and all the other new apps included in the new business catalog.

Additional Scope Items

Customers with the additional license for SAP Master Data Governance can active scope item Central Governance for Business Partner (1N7) for additional capabilities.

entry.title: Re: How to check if my enviroment is ASE stand-alone or B...
entry.content:
Hello,

Yes, is possible to check as suggested in this KBA: 3205662 - How to identify the ASE edition between SAP ASE (Stand-alone) and SAP ASE for Business Suite - SAP for Me

The KBA suggest to review the ASE log and search for the last server start messages:

Check the ASE error log file, <SID>.log located at /sybase/<SID>/ASE-16_0/install

  • SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise(stand-alone).

kernel  SySAM: Checked out license for 8 ASE_CORE (xxxx.xxxxx/permanent/xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx).
kernel  This product is licensed to: <Company Name>
kernel  Checked out license ASE_CORE

  • SAP ASE for Business Suite

kernel  SySAM: Checked out license for 4 ASE_CORE (xxxx.xxxxx/permanent/xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx).
kernel  This product is licensed to: SAP, for use with SAP Business Applications.
kernel  Checked out license ASE_CORE

It is also possible to have a notion about your enviroment seeing the databases in it. The Business Suite enviroment have some default databases like 'saptools'.

If you execute the ASE command "sp_helpdb" under master database, you will be able to see the server databases.

entry.title: Re: How do I remove Calibration Sessions views from an em...
entry.content:
I have also be researching this, and I am not finding a way to change or remove a facilitator from a session.  A few work arounds I have found:

  1. Access that particular template (previous year's) and enable the facilitator role for Restrict Calibration Role Access by Target Population in the template Advanced Settings.  You can remove this template from all facilitators' except the those that are permmissioned to see this.  Even if the previous facilitator can still see the session, if their target population no longer includes anyone in this session, it will appear blank.
  2. Delete the session.  I ran an export and report on the session and deleted it.  We did not use comments and it was a simple rating calibration session, so this was not too complicated to capture for historical needs.  Not ideal, but removing access to this session was more important than retaining it.
  3. Reactivating the session - if it is not a form-driven process (succession, for example), reopen then deactivate and remove the facilitator.  I have started using a PM/GM admin profile as the default facilitator in the calibration settings to replace inactive facilitators or be the default facilitator (like below).  Add this profile as the facilitator or whomever it should be, validate, activate then finalize.  This is NOT truly feasible for a form driven process, but I guess that would depend on the importance of this facilitator's visibility concerns.

Hope this helps - TKramer

entry.title: Re: Automatically splitting items in a PI document when t...
entry.content:
Hello @Nihit

The key misunderstanding is, Maximum Number of Items already is the split control. If you set to 999 or safer 900, the system will split automatically so no PI document exceeds that number. So, if your goal is to split HUs exceed 999, then you should set maximum number of items to 999 or 900

Setting it to 20 will not cause any document to exceed 999. It will simply create many smaller documents, each up to 20 items. The fact that some documents may have fewer lines is normal and expected.

You still get 10,000 Hus in one document when the creation run is not being executed in the split capable way, or your selection is grouped in a way that overrides the split. In public cloud, you cannot enforce an advanced perfect packing split for exactly equal size documents. Public cloud offers you Activity Area split, Maximum Number of Items split and additional selection restrictions you apply yourself.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to solve OData error /IWCOR/CX_OD_URI_NOT_MATCHING Resource not found for segment 'XXXXXX'
entry.content:
Short answer, specific to the question

There's a difference in the name between the service definition (the alias of the entity is Alt_Payee) and in the request body (POST AltPayee HTTP/1.1). One solution: in the request body, use POST Alt_Payee HTTP/1.1.

 

Answer to all situations of "Resource not found for segment"

/IWCOR/CX_OD_URI_NOT_MATCHING may correspond to several messages, and there's one GUID per message. The GUID "005056A509B11EE38DCB75E2A43B5206" corresponds to the message "Resource not found for segment 'XXXXXXXXX'".
 
I'm answering about the message "Resource not found for segment", not about all the other messages of /IWCOR/CX_OD_URI_NOT_MATCHING.
 
The segment name (XXXXXXXXX) is meant to be the name of an entity set, an action or a function, the name XXXXXXXXX is located:
  • either at the end of your URL path if it doesn't contain $batch, e.g. https://path/service/XXXXXXXXX or https://path/service/XXXXXXXXX?anything
  • or if the URL path contains $batch (e.g. path/service/entityset/$batch), at the right of the HTTP method (POST, GET, etc.) inside any of the application/http parts of the request body, e.g.

--batch...
Content- Type: multipart/...
...
Content- Type: application/http
...
POST XXXXXXXXX HTTP /1.1

...
--batch...--
 
You may find the segment name XXXXXXXXX:
  • as an entity set (CDS view) or its alias in a Service Definition, for instance
define service z_your_service_definition {
  expose z_your_cds_view as XXXXXXXXX;
}
  • as an action or a function. The possibilities for these OData operations come from the OData Standards and are explained in this blog post (which also concerns SAP CAP): Cheat sheet for URI patterns for calling OData act... - SAP Community
    • NB: the abstracts below are copied from the blog post !
    • The texts in bold below correspond to XXXXXXXXX.
    • Short abstract for action paths:
      • Bound action: pathToService/EntitySet(key)/ServiceName.actionName
      • Unbound action: pathToService/actionName
      • In OData V2, a bound action may also be written like this: pathToService/EntitySet_actionName?key=<value>
    • Short abstract for function paths:
      • Bound function: pathToService/EntitySet(key)/ServiceName.functionName(paramName1=<value>,...)
      • Unbound function: pathToService/functionName(paramName1=<value>,paramName2=<value>)
      • In OData V2, a bound function may also be written like this: pathToService/EntitySet_functionName?key=<value>&paramName1=<value>&...
    • For information:
      • "ServiceName" is referred as "Namespace" in the OData Standards and in the note 3533496 below.
      • The term "Bound" applies to exactly one entity.
      • The term "Unbound" applies to all entities of the entity set. Examples given by ChatGPT: RebuildIndex, ImportData, SendBulkNotifications, CalculateStatistics...
If you have checked everything and it still doesn't work, maybe you didn't pay attention to a tiny difference in the segment name; also, be careful, the name is case-sensitive!
 
Also, a common error could be the selection of the wrong service line in /IWFND/V4_ADMIN, don't test the service of the repository DEFAULT :
 
The note 3533496 - OData V4 Bound Action : Resource not found for segment 'XXXXXXXXX' is specific to the bound actions. It's just mentioning "Add the namespace in the URI before the operation name and correct the case sensitivity for the parameter" and refers to the "cheat sheet" blog post above.

entry.title: Re: Unable to purchase any product in SAP Store as partne...
entry.content:
Hi All,

I found the solution after discussing with Store Admin team. 

Root Cause: The role for license buying was not assigned to my ID as my ID was changed recently.

Sol: In me.sap.com -> Users & Contacts -> Manage Users and Authorizations -> Go to Auth Package tab -> Define Auth Package with all roles under "SAP for Me Website" and save. (If possible, create Auth Package with all roles)

Now, assign this Auth Package to your user having Super User role assigned in Users Tile, by selecting it and assigning the package.

Now, wait for it to synch in the system for 24-48 hours and the issue shall be resolved for you.

 

Note: To test the resolution, login in Incognito mode so the data is refreshed.

which is a composite listing of all supported systems/services and the specific configuration steps you need to take.  (See SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Datasphere links on this page.)

The SAP Cloud ALM for Operations Expert Portal (https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal.html) breaks down the various use cases and within each, has the various system/services config steps linked there as well.
I hope this is helpful to you.
Best regards,
Paula

entry.title: Library Management - Schedule SF Learning to require course owner review of content??
entry.content:
I would like to improve how I maintain a current "catalog" of content. Currently I rely on content owners to let me know if they need to update their content. However, that often doesn't happen and we end up with greatly outdated content available to view. 

A cursory review caused me to think there was a system to do that through approvers and approval roles. I had hoped I could put a "3-year Review and Subject Matter Expert Approval" requirement that would automatically assign the item to the course owner or SME to review and approve. However, now that I am really digging in, I can only see how that applies to people approving for a user / learner to take a course. I do not see how I can apply that to content. 

Does this functionality exist? Can you provide direction if so? 

Thank you,
